hierarchy.lvl1: quick-start" description="Step-by-step guides to setting up your system and installing the library." /%}

content: {% quick-link title="Architecture guide" icon="presets" href="/" description="Learn how the internals work and contribute." /%}  {% quick-link title="Widget" icon="plugins" href="/" description="Integrate the checkout widget into your website without programming it from scratch." /%}  {% quick-link title="API reference" icon="theming" href="/" description="See the entiere API reference." /%}  {% /quick-links %}  ---
Do you want to start right away? Then install RWA SDK with a command line.

The SDK is written in **TypeScript** and can be imported into React, Vue and Angular applications. The SDK will be also in other languages such as **Go** and **Python** available.  ```typescript npm install rwa-tokenized-sdk ```  After the library is installed just importing it to you (decentralized) application.

```js // App.tsx import { createRWAClient } from 'rwa-tokenized-sdk' ```  {% callout title="You should know!" %} We will start with creating your own RWA property. Each property is tokenized as ERC1155 tokens and the metadata is saved on IPFS.  There are two ways to create a property:  a) Using the library directly and calling the function `rwa.launchProperty()` within your implementation.  b) Or you can use the RWA launchpad interface if you want to skip an own implementation. The result is that you get a `propertyAddress` which is essential for the RWA Property.  {% /callout %}  ---
If you need help then write us at [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/5mwebaUMpk)
Call the `launchProperty()` function to create a tokenized property. In the background an own ERC1155 contract is created for the property

In the first step you need to import the RWA SDK into your JavaScript/TypeScript project.  ```js import { createRWAClient } from 'rwa-tokenized-sdk' ```  **Interface**  ```js export interface LaunchPropertyParams {   assetName: string;   assetType: string;   description: string;   isOwner: boolean;   approximatedValue: bigint | string;   totalSupply: bigint | string;   propertyAddress: string;   squareMeters: bigint | string;   uri: string; } ```  **Function**  ```js rwa.launchProperty(params, signer) ```  **Params**  | Name   | Type | Description                                     | Result  | | ------ | ---- | ----------------------------------------------- | ------- | | params | LaunchPropertyParams  | Property launch parameters | LaunchPropertyResult | | signer | any  | Sending transactions a signer need to be passed | - |

```js try {  const result = await rwa.launchProperty({     assetName: 'Downtown Office Building',     assetType: 'Real Estate',     description: 'Premium office building',     isOwner: true,     approximatedValue: BigInt('1000000000000000000000'),     totalSupply: BigInt('1000000'),     propertyAddress: '123 Main St',     squareMeters: BigInt('500'),     uri: 'ipfs://Qm...'   }, signer);   console.log('Property launched:', result.propertyAddress); } catch(e: any) {   console.log(e); } ```  ---

content: You are also able to use the RWA launchpad interface to create properties [link](https://rwa-sdk.com/rwa-launch)
